item.title: ‚ÄúHundreds of thousands of people in Sudan are in the streets...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

‚ÄúHundreds of thousands of people in Sudan are in the streets courageously resisting the coup staged by the military on Monday. The country‚Äôs top armed forces leader Lt. Gen. Abdel Fattah al-Burhan announced the take over and declared a state of emergency. As part of the coup, soldiers arrested Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok and other high ranking civilian officials, and it was revealed today that Hamdok was being held captive at al-Burhan‚Äôs personal residence.

This coup dissol...ved the 2-year old joint civilian-military Sovereign Council, which took over the country following a people‚Äôs revolution that began in December 2018 ‚Äî referred to in the country as the December Revolution. That revolution, sparked by anti-worker austerity measures that led to spiraling food and fuel prices, deposed long-time military ruler Omar al-Bashir and forced the installation of a civilian cabinet led by Hamdok that was meant to lead the country until elections were held. But the institutional power of the military remained a force to be reckoned with, and the armed forces continually attempted to undermine the transition to a new, democratic form of government.

Huge numbers of supporters of the revolution are staging a general strike and a campaign of total civil disobedience. Barricades have been put up along main roads and in different sections of major cities to deny the military control. The resistance is determined to struggle despite severe repression from police and soldiers, who have fired live ammunition at civilians. Reports indicate that at least 10 people have been killed so far. But the true number may be far higher, as information from inside Sudan has been obstructed by an internet blackout imposed by the military.‚Äù

Read the full article on Liberation News:

item.title: PSL stands with the Sudanese people in their struggle against...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

PSL stands with the Sudanese people in their struggle against military rule! üá∏üá© On Monday, October 25th, Sudan's military dissolved the transitional government and arrested civilian leaders in what can only be described as a coup. This came hours after a visit from the US envoy to Sudan, who met with leaders of the transitional government. The Sudanese Communist Party has called for international solidarity actions to demand an end to military rule and the release of the civilian leaders of the transitional government.

Read about the 2019 people‚Äôs uprising in Sudan that is the context of this struggle on Liberation News: https://www.liberationnews.org/struggle-in-sudan-a-revolut‚Ä¶/

#SudanCoup #AllEyesOnSudan

item.title: "Congress has the authority to prevent 11 million evictions...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"Congress has the authority to prevent 11 million evictions from taking place in the midst of a pandemic. This could be accomplished by incorporating an eviction freeze into the social spending budget that is currently under consideration. Because it is being voted on under a process known as ‚Äúbudget reconciliation‚Äù, such a maneuver would allow a nationwide eviction moratorium to avoid having to meet the undemocratic 60-vote ‚Äúfilibuster‚Äù threshold in the Senate. Participants in the Cancel the Rents actions refused to accept excuses from politicians and demanded that Congress act with the urgency this dire crisis calls for."

As part of national days of protest called by Cancel the Rents, more than 60 demonstrations took place in cities and towns across the United States September 24-26 calling on Congress to immediately pass an indefinite nationwide moratorium on evictions. #canceltherents #evictions #housing

liberationnews.org

item.title: We won‚Äôt go back‚Äîwe will fight back! Today people across the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

We won‚Äôt go back‚Äîwe will fight back! Today people across the US took to the streets in protest against the heinous anti-abortion bill SB8, which was passed in Texas and allowed to go into effect by the Supreme Court. In Denver, we joined the Womxn's March Denver rally then led a march through downtown.

Abortion is healthcare‚Äînot a moral debate or a political bargaining chip. We demand Congress act now to legalize abortion once and for all at the federal level. No more tug-of-war over our rights!

item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver was live.

CONGRESS: Act now to stop evictions! People in more than 50 cities across the country took part in protests this weekend calling on Congress to take action and stop the eviction of 11 million people!

We demand that:

Congress pass an indefinite moratorium on evictions that covers 100% of the country!

...

Governor Jared Polis dramatically speed up the distribution of already-allocated renter relief funds!

Congress cancel the rents and wipe out all rent and mortgage debt accumulated during the pandemic!

item.title: Hundreds marched in Denver today alongside cities across the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Hundreds marched in Denver today alongside cities across the U.S. to demand citizenship and full rights for all immigrants NOW!

In honor of the historic Day Without an Immigrant on May 1, 2006 -- in which millions of immigrant workers and their allies marked International Workers' Day with strikes, walkouts, boycotts, and mass demonstrations -- today's marchers wore white shirts and retraced the steps of the original march route that took place in Denver fifteen years ago, ta...king over the street from Viking Park in Northwest Denver to the center of the city.

Before the march, immigrants representing cities and towns all across Colorado spoke out against the cruel deportations, detentions, and exploitation facing millions of undocumented and other immigrant workers in this country.

The message was militant, determined and clear: NOW is the time! Congress and President Biden must:

‚Ä¢ Create a pathway to citizenship for all 11+ million undocumented immigrants!
‚Ä¢ Ensure that a pathway to citizenship is included in the reconciliation bill, and pass it!
‚Ä¢ Welcome all refugees and asylees including those from Afghanistan, Haiti, and Central America, and work to provide them a pathway to citizenship
‚Ä¢ Stop all deportations, detentions, and family separations in our immigrant communities!

Exigiremos lo siguiente al Congreso y Biden:

‚Ä¢ ¬°Cree un camino hacia la ciudadan√≠a para los m√°s de 11 millones de inmigrantes indocumentados!
‚Ä¢ ¬°Aseg√∫rese de que se incluya un camino hacia la ciudadan√≠a en el proyecto de ley de reconciliaci√≥n, y p√°selo!
‚Ä¢ Dar la bienvenida a todos los refugiados y asilados, incluidos los de Afganist√°n, Hait√≠ y Am√©rica Central, y trabajar para proporcionarles un camino hacia la ciudadan√≠a.
‚Ä¢ ¬°Detengan todas las deportaciones, detenciones y separaciones familiares en nuestras comunidades de inmigrantes!

item.title: "A total of 96 officers have parted ways with the Aurora...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"A total of 96 officers have parted ways with the Aurora Police Department so far in 2021, with another two staffers expected to split by week‚Äôs end. ... The number of exits among APD ranks through the middle of September already dwarfs totals from last year, when 87 officials left Aurora police ‚Äî a 61% increase over 2019. Resignations are the driving force behind the exodus"

While Aurora's situation is even more acute due to the intense condemnation the department has earned itself, this is a trend police departments are experiencing nationwide. The veneer that the police protect and serve the people of this country is slipping and the scrutiny police now know to expect is driving many would-be cops from signing up.

The mass movement against racist police terror is causing historic shifts. The fight only continues!

‚ÄúFor 21 months we have been in the spotlight ‚Äî some for our own doing and I‚Äôm not trying to defend any of the individuals that I‚Äôve held accountable or terminated ‚Äî but it has been a very rough go to wear the Aurora police patch,‚Äù said Chief Vanessa Wilson.

item.title: BREAKING: State investigation finds racism and excessive force...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING: State investigation finds racism and excessive force rampant within Aurora Police Department

AG Phil Weiser began his press conference saying, "Last summer we heard loudly and clearly, the people of Colorado expect more from law enforcement."

The exposure and accountability now facing APD and others involved in brutalizing and abusing the people of Aurora is unparalleled in Aurora's history. It was the people who forced this change by coming together by the thousan...ds, month after month, demanding it.

The people have the power to change our society. This is only the beginning!
